column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Eurovision ' 73 and initial mainstream success
#Text=When you competed for Luxembourg , one country winning twice in a row was still rare .
#Text=Was there a lot of pressure for you to win the grand prize for Luxembourg ?
#Text=Did you also feel pressure to succeed from yourself ?
#Text=There was no need to win the grand prize except in my head .
#Text=I felt sure that an opportunity like that one was unique and that I would not have it a second time ...
#Text=I was incorrect ... I got it twice !
#Text=What I mean to say is that Eurovision remains for me a musical contest before all else , although of course a good song is worth nothing without a good [ singer ] .
#Text=Thus the need to have both !
#Text=I 've always had a taste for challenges ...
#Text=Eurovision is one .
#Text=And among the challenges I like the competition , so when challenge and competition are combined , I think only of victory .
#Text=I think it would be ridiculous and useless to go to Eurovision without wanting to win !
#Text=I never participate in a contest , or anywhere for that matter , when it consists of singing with a tourist view of it .
#Text=I prioritize my work and the result of my work .
#Text=This has not allowed me to visit many things in all the countries where I have been in competition , but this allowed me to never find myself poorly ranked or last .

#Text=One must know whether one wants victory or tourism ... and I think it 's a lack of respect to all those who count on us , and all those who spend a lot [ of time ] ( production , television , etc ... ) to not take every chance to rank better or not put every chance of winning on our side .
#Text=You ended up in a three-way dead heat between Mocedades from Spain and Cliff Richard from the United Kingdom , who both performed songs some fans also consider worthy of the grand prize .
#Text=What were your opinions of those songs ?
#Text=If , hypothetically , your song did n't win , do you think either of them were strong enough to be winner material ?
#Text=1973 was a year very rich in quality candidates ...
#Text=the proof :
#Text=victory came to me with just a very few points ahead .
#Text=The ranking of that year 's other candidates was what I dreaded most .

#Text=Mocedades was a pure moment of happiness and of a formidable effectiveness ; Cliff Richard benefited from an exceptional notoriety and a mastery of the scene that I was far from having ; so I needed to play everything I had ... but I told you that I 'd chosen victory , not tourism !
#Text=During the mid-1970s , you did many tours of Turkey and the Middle East , and won reporters ' music awards there .
#Text=What was the best thing you liked about being in Turkey ?
#Text=What experiences did you have that really stand out in your mind even today ?
